1 #include "bb_computation/cue.h"

8 //
9 // Cue class implementation
10 //
11 
12 //
13 // Ctor
14 //
15 Cue::Cue(cv::Point location, const cv::Mat& frame_ref) {
16  // Use const frame reference to determine the frame
17  // centre without modifying the frame itself.
18  double frame_centre_x = frame_ref.cols / 2;
19  double frame_centre_y = frame_ref.rows / 2;
20  frame_x = location.x;
21  frame_y = location.y;
22  centre_x = frame_centre_x;
23  centre_y = frame_centre_y;
24 
25  this->updateInternalRepresentation();
26 }
27 
28 //
29 // Private method
30 //
31 void Cue::updateInternalRepresentation(){
32  x = frame_x - centre_x;
33  y = frame_y - centre_y;
34  r = sqrt(x*x + y*y);
35  theta = atan2(y, x);
36 }
37 
38 //
39 // Public methods
40 //
41 
42 //
43 // Draw the cue vector on an openCV frame
44 //
45 cv::Mat& Cue::drawCueVectorOnFrame(cv::Mat &frame){
46  cv::Mat &colour = colour_frame;
47  cv::cvtColor(frame, colour, cv::COLOR_GRAY2RGB);
48  cv::Point origin(centre_x, centre_y);
49  cv::Point location(frame_x, frame_y);
50  cv::arrowedLine(colour, origin, location, cv::Scalar(0,0,255));
51  return colour;
52 }
53 
54 //
55 // Update the coordinates of the cue.
56 // Arguments are expected to be with respect to the image
57 //
58 void Cue::updateFrameCoordinates(double frame_x_coord, double frame_y_coord){
59  frame_x = frame_x_coord;
60  frame_y = frame_y_coord;
61 
62  // Transform coordinates to central axes, compute polar coordinates.
63  this->updateInternalRepresentation();
64 }
65 
66 //
67 // Update the coordinates of the cue.
68 // Arguments are expected to be with respect to the image
69 //
70 void Cue::updateFrameCoordinates(cv::Point location){
71  frame_x = location.x;
72  frame_y = location.y;
73 
74  // Transform coordinates to central axes, compute polar coordinates.
75  this->updateInternalRepresentation();
76 }
77 
78 //
79 // Getters; only publically accessible features should be the strength and
80 // the direction.
81 //
82 double Cue::strength(){ return r; }
83 double Cue::direction(){ return theta; }
84 
85 //
86 // Translate the cue into a ROS message
87 //
88 bb_computation::cue_vector Cue::toMessage(){
89  bb_computation::cue_vector msg;
90  msg.magnitude = this->strength();
91  msg.theta = this->direction();
92  return msg;
93 }
